sports.name: Soccer
sports.description: A team sport played between two teams of eleven players with a spherical ball.

sports.name: Basketball
sports.description: A team sport where two teams, usually of five players each, oppose each other on a rectangular court.

sports.name: Baseball
sports.description: A bat-and-ball game played between two opposing teams who take turns batting and fielding.

sports.name: American Football
sports.description: A team sport played by two teams of eleven players on a rectangular field with goalposts at each end.

sports.name: Tennis
sports.description: A racquet sport that can be played individually against a single opponent or between two teams of two players each.

sports.name: Volleyball
sports.description: A team sport in which two teams of six players are separated by a net.

sports.name: Cricket
sports.description: A bat-and-ball game played between two teams of eleven players on a field.

sports.name: Rugby
sports.description: A team sport played with an oval ball that can be kicked, carried, and passed from hand to hand.

sports.name: Ice Hockey
sports.description: A contact team sport played on ice, usually in a rink, in which two teams of skaters use sticks to shoot a puck into the opponent's net.

sports.name: Field Hockey
sports.description: A team game of the hockey family played on grass or artificial turf.

sports.name: Golf
sports.description: A club-and-ball sport in which players use various clubs to hit balls into a series of holes on a course in as few strokes as possible.

sports.name: Swimming
sports.description: An individual or team racing sport that requires the use of one's entire body to move through water.

sports.name: Track and Field
sports.description: A sport which includes athletic contests established on the skills of running, jumping, and throwing.

sports.name: Boxing
sports.description: A combat sport in which two people throw punches at each other for a predetermined amount of time in a boxing ring.

sports.name: Wrestling
sports.description: A combat sport involving grappling type techniques such as clinch fighting, throws, and takedowns.

sports.name: Judo
sports.description: A modern martial art, combat and Olympic sport created in Japan.

sports.name: Karate
sports.description: A martial art developed in the Ryukyu Kingdom, now an Olympic sport.

sports.name: Taekwondo
sports.description: A Korean martial art characterized by punching and kicking techniques.

sports.name: Gymnastics
sports.description: A sport that includes exercises requiring balance, strength, flexibility, agility, coordination, and endurance.

sports.name: Cycling
sports.description: A sport of riding bicycles, including road, track, mountain biking, and BMX.

sports.name: Table Tennis
sports.description: Also known as ping-pong, a sport in which two or four players hit a lightweight ball back and forth across a table using small bats.

sports.name: Badminton
sports.description: A racquet sport played using racquets to hit a shuttlecock across a net.

sports.name: Squash
sports.description: A racquet sport played by two or four players in a four-walled court with a small, hollow rubber ball.

sports.name: Rowing
sports.description: A sport in which athletes race against each other in boats, using oars.

sports.name: Sailing
sports.description: A sport that involves moving a boat by harnessing the power of wind.

sports.name: Canoeing
sports.description: A paddle sport in which one paddles a canoe with a single-bladed paddle.

sports.name: Downhill Skiing
sports.description: A winter sport where athletes slide down snow-covered hills on skis with fixed-heel bindings.

sports.name: Cross-Country Skiing
sports.description: A form of skiing where participants propel themselves across snow-covered terrain using skis and poles.

sports.name: Ski Jumping
sports.description: A winter sport where competitors aim to achieve the longest jump after descending from a specially designed ramp.

sports.name: Water Skiing
sports.description: A surface water sport where an individual is pulled behind a boat or cable ski installation over a body of water.

sports.name: Snowboarding
sports.description: A winter sport that involves descending a slope covered with snow while standing on a snowboard.

sports.name: Surfing
sports.description: A surface water sport in which the wave rider rides on the forward face of a moving wave.

sports.name: Skateboarding
sports.description: An action sport which involves riding and performing tricks using a skateboard.

sports.name: Climbing
sports.description: The activity of using one's hands, feet, or any other part of the body to ascend a steep object.

sports.name: Equestrian
sports.description: Sports that involve horse riding, including dressage, show jumping, and eventing.

sports.name: Shooting
sports.description: A sport involving tests of proficiency using various types of guns.

sports.name: Archery
sports.description: The sport of using a bow to shoot arrows.

sports.name: Fencing
sports.description: A group of three related combat sports using bladed weapons.

sports.name: Weightlifting
sports.description: An athletic discipline in which participants attempt a maximum-weight single lift of a barbell loaded with weight plates.

sports.name: Triathlon
sports.description: A multisport race with three continuous and sequential endurance races, usually swimming, cycling, and running.

sports.name: Stock Car Racing
sports.description: A form of automobile racing found mainly in the United States and Canada, using production-based cars.

sports.name: Formula One Racing
sports.description: The highest class of international single-seater auto racing sanctioned by the FIA.

sports.name: Motocross Racing
sports.description: An off-road motorcycle racing held on enclosed off-road circuits.

sports.name: Motorcycle Racing
sports.description: A sport involving racing motorcycles, including road racing, off-road racing, and track racing.

sports.name: Horse Racing
sports.description: An equestrian performance sport involving two or more horses ridden by jockeys over a set distance.

sports.name: Lacrosse
sports.description: A team sport played with a lacrosse stick and a lacrosse ball.

sports.name: Netball
sports.description: A ball sport played by two teams of seven players, predominantly played by women.

sports.name: Handball
sports.description: A team sport in which two teams of seven players each pass a ball to throw it into the goal of the other team.

sports.name: Water Polo
sports.description: A competitive team sport played in water between two teams of seven players.

sports.name: Diving
sports.description: The sport of jumping or falling into water from a platform or springboard.

sports.name: Figure Skating
sports.description: A sport in which individuals, duos, or groups perform on figure skates on ice.

sports.name: Curling
sports.description: A sport in which players slide stones on a sheet of ice towards a target area segmented into four concentric circles.

sports.name: Pickleball
sports.description: A paddleball sport that combines elements of badminton, table tennis, and tennis.

sports.name: Ultimate Frisbee
sports.description: A non-contact team sport played with a flying disc.

sports.name: Kabaddi
sports.description: A contact team sport played between two teams of seven players each originating from the Indian subcontinent.

sports.name: Sepak Takraw
sports.description: A sport native to Southeast Asia, resembling volleyball but played with feet and a rattan ball.

sports.name: Australian Rules Football
sports.description: A contact sport played between two teams of eighteen players on an oval-shaped field.

sports.name: Hurling
sports.description: An outdoor team game of ancient Gaelic Irish origin, played with sticks and a ball.

sports.name: Gaelic Football
sports.description: An Irish team sport, combining the skills of soccer and rugby.

sports.name: Polo
sports.description: A horseback mounted team sport, with the objective to score goals against an opposing team.

sports.name: Floorball
sports.description: An indoor team sport, a type of floor hockey with five field players and a goalkeeper.

sports.name: Softball
sports.description: A variant of baseball played with a larger ball on a smaller field.

sports.name: Mixed Martial Arts
sports.description: A full-contact combat sport that allows striking and grappling.
